intro: Humiria cassiquiari, commonly known as the Cassiquiare humiria, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near water sources. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
